title: CIS-Lab receives multi-year grant for human-AI collaboration research
description: Our team was awarded a new grant to explore trustworthy AI for healthcare decision support systems.
content: The Cryptography and Information Security Laboratory (CIS-Lab) will lead a three-year initiative focused on trustworthy decision support tools for clinicians.
The project brings together collaborators from medicine, human-computer interaction, and privacy-preserving machine learning to deploy pilot systems at partner hospitals.

title: New publication accepted at ACM CHI
description: Congratulations to the Interactive Systems group for their paper on explainable user interfaces.
content: The paper proposes a lightweight explanation toolkit that enables rapid testing of transparency techniques in interactive environments.
Lead author Sophia Patel will present the work during the Explainable AI session on May 8 in Honolulu, HI.

title: Welcome our 2025 cohort of graduate researchers
description: We are excited to welcome six new graduate students joining the lab this semester.
content: Incoming students will join research thrusts in secure distributed systems, post-quantum cryptography, and human factors in security.
Please join us in welcoming them at the spring kickoff reception on February 2.
